title: Alternate DIN?
content:
looking for an id on this face. it doesn’t seem to match any versions of din i’ve seen. it looks like a slightly condensed (but not as condensed as the condensed pro) and maybe rounded (or is that just the aliasing...not sure).

any ideas?

thanks,  
michael

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [type21.png](http://web.archive.org/web/20090803121309/http:/typophile.com/files/type21.png) | 13.99 KB |
author: chiaroscuro

comments.content:
I think it is “Miso”, and it’s a free font.  
you can find it here: [http://www.omkrets.se/typografi/](http://web.archive.org/web/20090803121309/http:/www.omkrets.se/typografi/ "http://www.omkrets.se/typografi/")
Look closely at the S and R in the provided sample and in Miso. They’re very different.

Yes, I was wrong.  
it is indeed Lineto.

thanks so much! also for the link to miso.

grazie,  
michael
